intro: Eriocaulon alatum, commonly known as the feather tassel sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and distinctive, feathery inflorescences that give it its common name. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Eriocaulon alatum is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various aquatic and semi-aquatic conditions.
